Monitoring and Controlling Memory Adaptation

  • Reconfigurability Monitoring:

    • For more complex code (e.g., if the list’s data field is moderately large, and elements are accessed in irregular fashion, the compiler cannot do such a careful allocation job as before.
    • But it can
      • Set up monitors for accessing various data-structure fields.
      • Decide on a limit (based on analysis and profile info) after which monitor statistics are examined at RT and a switch (based on compiler-based scripts) is done in configuration patterns.
      • Set up initial configuration.
